intro: Hirnellia cotuloides, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its propagation. Hirnellia cotuloides is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
